CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: P1 with three solubilizing n-dodecyl groups has good solubility in common organic solvents such as chloroform , THF , and toluene.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| ------------ |
| n-dodecyl groups with three solubilizing units |
| chloroform |
| THF (tetrahydrofuran) |
| toluene |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| ------------ |
| n-dodecyl groups with three solubilizing units |
| chloroform |
| THF (tetrahydrofuran) |
| toluene |

Explanation:
The paragraph mentions "n-dodecyl groups with three solubilizing units" as having good solubility in certain solvents. This can be considered a material or compound. The solvents mentioned, chloroform, THF, and toluene, are also materials. Therefore, these are the valid material entities in the paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: P1 with three solubilizing n-dodecyl groups has good solubility in common organic solvents such as chloroform , THF , and toluene.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| P1 with three solubilizing n-dodecyl groups |
| good solubility |
| in common organic solvents |
| such as chloroform |
| THF |
| and toluene. |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| P1 with three solubilizing n-dodecyl groups having good solubility |
| in common organic solvents |
| such as chloroform |
| THF |
| and toluene. |

Explanation: "good solubility" is a material property that describes how well a substance can mix with another substance (in this case, common organic solvents). Therefore, it is a valid entity to include in the table. The other entities in the paragraph, "P1 with three solubilizing n-dodecyl groups" and "common organic solvents, chloroform, THF, and toluene," are also valid entities as they refer to the material being described and the solvents it is soluble in, respectively.
